article.title: Simulation Teaching of Library Administration
article.author: Zachert, M.J.K.
article.text: The underlying concepts of simulation and experimential teaching methods presented in this book have been borrowed from other fields - business, governmental and education administration primarily. The values for library educators are not hypothetical, however, for the methodology has been successfully used over a period of time by a number of teachers, and in a variety of educational settings related to career training for librarians. Neither is the approach overpersonalized. Much of the telling is in personal terms, in order to limit generalization, to induce acceptance of responsibility and to provide concrete examples in terms of teaching library administration. The assumption is that it will be easier for library educators to react creatively to methodological discourse couched in library science terms than if the same methodology were described in terms of high finance, international politics, militarism, or secondary school planning.
